ygData.subject: Re: Is the verdict finally in?
ygData.msgSnippet: ok enough enough, i will finally tell you all the way it is with hacking EQ. to hack eq, you could do the following, change items on your chr and find all
ygData.messageBody:
ok enough enough, i will finally tell you all the way it is with hacking EQ.

to "hack" eq, you could do the following, change items on your chr and
find all items ingame and then equip them, change the amount of pp your chr
has, the race avatar, class avatar, and a few other things.

the how to "hack" EQ. you would have to have 2 computers, set up on a rpoxy
and have one be the base server for the internet server and play eq on the
one that is not the server. then with the one that has the proxy server get
a winpacket editor and search for strings and such on the line. once oyu
make, yes you would have to make a search engine and sniffer, you oculd
start to find what thigns are what of all the info being sent to and from EQ
servers. once you discover what strings do what then you oculd alter them on
your side once you are sent the packet then once the packet is sent back it
would thus be saved on the server side. the problem is you would have to be
able to "grab" a packet to edit it. then send it back and make the server
think it was doing its job and you were jsut getting pl.

ok there is the LD on it and if you have any questions please FLAME ON,
also you could do this iwth a sys running win98 and then any other sys that
could run the software required.


nubious





----- Original Message -----
From: Trevalien Manix <trevalien@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 11:33 AM
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?


> From: "Trevalien Manix" <trevalien@...>
>
> I have looked through my EQ directory and have seen a few things.
>
> A.) The graphics/sounds are on your computer. They have names like
> qeynoshills.xmi, qeynoshills.s3d. It may be posible to remove
> fog/rain/darkness/ocean (the fogyness underwater: you could make water
> crysatl clear)
> B.) There is a file that contains a list of guildnames and a single player
> name next to each of them. I assume this is the guild leader beacuse my
name
> is next to my guild. This file is full of giberish too which makes it hard
> to read.
> C.) There is a file that contains the names of every other file followed
by
> 3 small hex values. This may be used to check if files have been modified.
> Ex: qeynoshills.xmi d54sd3f46 54df7sd5g 6s8fs69sf
>
> There are no files containing anything that is recognizable (to me) as
info
> regarding your character. After thinking about it it would not be posible
to
> store that kind of info on your computer and still have the ability to
sell
> your acount (on E-bay)
>
> Trevalien
>
>
> >From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
> >Reply-To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> >To: "'EQCheats@onelist.com'" <EQCheats@onelist.com>
> >Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?
> >Date: Fri, 27 Aug 1999 11:23:20 -0500
> >
> >From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
> >
> >If there were a way to hack the files locally and give yourself items,
> >alter
> >your bank box, or anything important like that, people would have already
> >hacked it (and then Verant would have most likely put in something to try
> >to
> >fix it, so we would have heard about it).
> >
> >The only thing I see that's possible to hack would be the graphics files,
> >which HAVE to be local. No way they could send that much information over
> >the 'net, isn't possible. So, the graphics have to be stored locally. You
> >could write something to alter the packets as they come in to filter out
> >certain graphics messages (blind, rain, nighttime, spell effects, etc),
or
> >you might be able to hack the graphics files themseleves and just take
> >these
> >affects out.
> >
> >None of these bother me enough to want to wirte anything to filter
packets
> >though.... *chuckle*
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: kale usi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
> >Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 11:17 AM
> >To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> >Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?
> >
> >
> >From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>
> >
> > >From: Michael O'Reilly <michael@...>
> > >
> > >I think not. I play EQ a lot from different computers. Things I have to
> > >set up on each new computer are hotkeys, friends list, and ignore list.
> > >However, my character, equipment, bank balance, faction, current buffs,
> > >and location remain the same.
> > >
> > >That indicates to me that all of the second list are on the server, not
> > >the individual computer.
> > >
> >
> >Quite possibly true. I don't know for sure either way - in my opinion I
> >agree with you. However, the main thing I'm wondering at this point is -
> >what applications could hacking the files stored client side have? It has
> >me
> >
> >on pins and needles. I hope that nothing major comes of this. I'd hate
like
> >hell to see my hours of work earning items, cash, etc go down the tubes.
> >Yet
> >
> >on another aspect, I'm intrigued. 8p
> >
> >
